DOC.brief_summary: To compare different approach whole-body magnetic resonance angiography patient suffer peripheral arterial disease . Our hypothesis use new protocol improve diagnostic quality WB-MRA procedure .
DOC.brief_title: Whole-Body MRA 3T - A Comparison Between Two Different Scan Protocols
DOC.detailed_description: Patients suffer peripheral arterial disease must undergo imaging procedure endovascular surgical procedure . WB-MRA imaging procedure visualise arterial system . WB-MRA performed different manner . On option start scan head region continue body foot ( standard protocol ) . Another option use hybrid protocol first examine head lower leg follow examination pelvic upper leg region . A comparison standard hybrid protocol perform 3T high magnetic field system , therefore perform study .
DOC.criteria: Symptomatic low extremity ischemia ( claudication , ischemic wound ) Referred digital subtraction angiography ( DSA ) Renal insufficiency ( GFR < 30 ml/min ) Contraindications MRIexamination ( claustrophobia , metalimplants , pacemaker ) Dementia Pregnancy/lactation Allergy gadolinium base MRI contrast agent Acute disease
